title: Do you regret premarital sexual intercourse? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not in the slightest. Now, there are a few women that I had sex with that I regret sleeping with due to other circumstances, but never the act in general. This is actually one of the huge things that really made me realize that I was being lied to about A LOT of things. For my entire life, I was told that everyone who engaged in premarital sex had feelings of guilt and shame about it. I was taught that such feelings were absolutely inevitable if you weren’t bound by holy matrimony. There would be no escaping these terrible feelings and they would stay with you for your entire life. I bought it hook, line, and sinker because I trusted those who taught me this to never lie to me. And then I had sex for the first time. Even as we were taking our clothes off, I had that doubt in the back of my mind. I had to ask myself if I thought it was worth the cost. Well, having naked boobs in my hands shook that thought real quick. Totally worth it. And then the act was done. I had sex for the first time and then waited. I was mentally prepping myself for the incoming guilt. As I stared at her naked body in bed, I waited for the shame to kick in. And then I waited some more. Maybe it wouldn’t come until after this amazing feeling of joy faded. So I waited some more. Maybe I needed a day or two to realize the horrible thing that I had done. But no matter how long I waited, nor how many times I had sex, the feelings never came. No wash of grief over my “lost innocence”. No regret that I had betrayed my future spouse. No shame for the filthy things that I had done. Just pleasure and happiness. Love and joy. It took a while, but I eventually realized that it was a blatant lie. Here, I had fully expected the feelings and part of me even thought I might deserve them for not obeying God. They never appeared. Not even a glimmer. I had been lied to about one of the greatest experiences a human being can have, what else might they have lied about???

Do you ever regret having sex before marriage? No. Why would I? Why would anyone? I mean, I get that some people are brainwashed into thinking that they should “save themselves” for marriage, but those people are part of a constantly shrinking demographic, whereas people who have never been married are part of a constantly growing demographic. Of the people who do get married, half of them end up getting divorced, whether or not they “saved themselves.” Meanwhile, your odds of finding your mythical soulmate in your first sexual partner are slim to none, On a related note, the notion that marriage is a desirable goal in and of itself is somewhat dated. Sure, if you are in a long term relationship, there are sometimes distinct benefits to getting married, but viewing every first date as an interview for later matrimony is a recipe for long term misery. Sexual desire is by its very nature very fickle, and a much more realistic viewpoint is that most sexual and romantic entanglements will last about three months, at which point the desire for change will likely assert itself for at least one of the parties involved. Rinse, repeat, until you stumble upon someone with whom you may have a deeper connection. Actually getting married should be a much more considered and practical decision, made much later in a relationship, if that decision is ever made at all.

No. No. No. No. Hell No. I think that this is an old-fashioned, tired notion that discounts the effectiveness of birth control. Furthermore, couples are marrying later in life. It is simply not realistic to remain a “virgin” past 25 to 30 years old. At some point, one’s lack of experience becomes a hindrance, an insecurity rather than a salute to convention. Today, sex for procreation is not imperative to human survival. Given that sex is so pleasurable and that life sometimes is really shitty (Hurricane Harvey), why can't we indulge in an activity that is truly gratifying and glorious? Have sex with gusto! (And consent, birth control and with protection from STIs and STDs).

Gosh-darn it, no. I was 18 when I started having sex, that was back in 1973. If I waited for marriage, I’d have been 50 years old in 2005. That’s an insane length of time to wait until I could get married and then “get permission” to play with a spouse. FYI, 2005 is when marriage equality was passed in Canada; before that, I couldn’t even GET married, even I wanted to. I had no choice, I HAD to have sex before marriage. Not that I think the idea has any merit, in any case. So I took the chance and had sex outside of marriage, for DECADES. Strangely, I still haven’t been hit by lightning so I’m going to presume the angry Dude-on-a-Cloud isn’t all that bothered about it. Back here on the planet, I don’t get how picking up a piece of paper at the local city hall or whatever makes one jot or tittle of difference in whether I and my partner(s) can have a good time together.
I regret it the same way I regret this cheesecake.  I should have had more.

Oh goodness no. Human history is filled with many stupid ideas—phrenology, cow tipping, using chlorine trifluoride as rocket fuel, Brexit—but one of the absolute stupidest, the one that can make the guys who go cow-tipping say “well at least I’m not that dumb”—-is refusing to have sex until after you’re married. You want to wait until after you’ve made a lifelong commitment to find out whether or not you’re compatible enough to have a happy sex life? Really? The only way that makes any kind of sense is if either (a) you live in a society where marriage is what happens when a man purchases a woman to use as a brood mare, or (b) someone told you that putting tab A in slot B will make an invisible man angry enough to set you on fire, and you believed it. Since neither of those describes me, no, I have never regretted having sex before marriage.

No I don't. At least now I have some idea about what I will be doing on my first night after marriage. Apart from that If my wife is not a virgin. I would be more than happy as she would know what to do too.

upvoters.user_id: Jack Davies（デイビースジャック）

response.answer_text: I never had sex before my marriage. And, if I did, I would definitely regret. Although, it isn’t gonna be a lifetime guilt that’ll ruin my marriage. I would seek forgiveness from God and the person I’ve been intimate with.

Do you ever regret having sex before marriage? I’ve never had intercourse, but let’s say I have kissed more than one person. It’s been over 35 years since the last time this happened with anyone, but the fact remains: I now wish I had saved all of those kisses (along with anything else I may have done along the way) for my husband.
No. Honestly I regret trying so damn hard to wait for marriage. Sex changes a relationship and in a positive way.
Only that I haven't had more of it. I have had more than my fair share, granted, but could happily do with more.
